result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Defendant Christopher Gerard Bystra in court.  Attorney Joel H. Rosenthal in court for Christopher Gerard Bystra.  Attorney Tom Hasle in court for State of Wisconsin. Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered a Bench Warrant to be issued.
Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered a Bench Warrant to be issued REMAND TO COMMISSIONER. Court further orders that bail is forfeited.

Based on Defense Motion to Reschedule filed 9/6/2022 and Defense Counsel's phone call to the Court on 9/6/2022, Court grants the Hearing to be rescheduled from 9/9/2022 to 9/23/2022 at 1:30 p.m. Parties notified.
to Reschedule, filed.
Case scheduled for a hearing to address JusticePoint discharge report from 8/31 received by the Court
Pretrial Services DISCHARGE Report - received and filed
Justice Point Pretrial Services Violation Report received and filed.
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 3.

Defendant Christopher Gerard Bystra in court with attorney Joel H. Rosenthal.  Defendant Christopher Gerard Bystra in custody.  Jennifer L Pickett appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Christopher Gerard Bystra appeared by video means with Attorney. Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Triggiano, Branch 13.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant pled not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Case is adjourned to Branch 13.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for September 23, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

records.descr: DE competent to stand trial, suspension lifted

records.addlTxt: Defendant Christopher Gerard Bystra in court with attorney Joel H. Rosenthal.  Defendant Christopher Gerard Bystra in custody.  Nate Kristian McClure appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Christopher Gerard Bystra appeared by video means with Attorney Rosenthal who appeared in court. Court reviewed the doctor's report with parties.  State and defense do not contest the report.  Court held colloquy with defendant who agrees with the doctor's findings  that he is competent to proceed.  Court adopts the findings of competency.  Court reinstates the proceedings.   Court ordered defendant produced in ICCR for initial appearance.
from Dr. Krickeberg & Dr. Gust-Brey dated 8/15/2022, received and filed
cover letter to doctor's report, Received and Filed.
Case suspended to determine competency.
records.descr: DE not competent to stand trial, case suspended

records.addlTxt:
Attorney Joel H. Rosenthal in court, defendant Christopher Gerard Bystra not in court, in custody.  Julie D Knyszek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   
Case in court for competency hearing.  Parties in receipt of examiner's report. State does not challenge Dr. Niess' report.  Court qualified Dr. Niess to testify as an expert in the field of psychology.  Sworn for the State: Dr. Niess. Testimony closed.  Arguments heard. After review of all evidence, report and testimony of Dr. Niess, Court finds the defendant lacks substantial capacity to understand court proceedings or to assist in his own defense.  Court orders proceedings suspended.   Court ordered defendant committed to the Department of Health and Family Services for Institutional Care in order to restore competency within the statutory time frame. The Court further authorized DHS to administer medications or treatment to the defendant.  Order of Commitment signed and filed.  Defendant is REMANDED into the custody of the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department for transportation to the designated facility. FORTHWITH. 
Court orders case adjourned back to Branch 37 for Competency Review Hearing.   All parties are advised effective August 1, 2022 this case will be assigned to a Branch of RESERVE JUDGES.  Review hearing scheduled for August 18, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Joel H. Rosenthal in court, defendant Christopher Gerard Bystra not in court, in custody.  Thomas Hasle appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant unable to appear for reasons set forth in the record. Defense has made multiple attemps to review Dr. Niess' report with defendant and is unsuccessful. Case passed due to scheduling. Case recalled at 9:09 a.m. appearances remain the same. Court ordered case adjourned for competency hearing in Branch 37.  Competency hearing scheduled for June 24, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Joel H. Rosenthal in court, defendant Christopher Gerard Bystra not in court, in custody.  Thomas Hasle appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant refused to appear in court.  Attorney Rosenthal has not had an opportunity to review the report with defendant due to lack of cooperation by the defendant. Matter set for competency hearing in Branch 37.  Competency hearing scheduled for June 17, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Dated 5/16/22 from Dr. Niess, received and filed.

Attorney Joel H. Rosenthal in court, defendant Christopher Gerard Bystra not in court, in custody.  Thomas Hasle appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
HEARING HELD VIA ZOOM/ LIVE STREAMING THROUGH DACAST. Case in court for return on doctor'ss report. 
Court in receipt of Doctor's request for additional time for evaluation. Court grants doctor's request. 
Court orders matter adjourned. Case remains calendared in Branch 37. 
  Doctor's Report Return scheduled for May 23, 2022 at 08:30 am.

forwarded to court
Order for Competency Examination signed and filed.
Forensic evaluation ordered.  INITIAL APPEARANCE NOT HELD.  Trial court to address INITIAL APPEARANCE on next court date.

Defendant Christopher Gerard Bystra in court with attorney Vincent Paul Guimont.  Defendant Christopher Gerard Bystra in custody.  Anthony J Moore appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Christopher Gerard Bystra appeared by video means with Attorney.  Court is advised by the defense there is reason to believe the defendant is not competent to proceed.  Pursuant to Sec. 971.14 (2) Wisconsin Statutes, Court found probable cause and ordered defendant examined by the Forensic Unit.  Order for Examination, signed and filed.   Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Dee, Branch 37.   Court ordered defendant REMANDED into custody of Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department.  Commissioner tolls the time limits for the preliminary hearing.  Doctor's Report Return scheduled for May 9, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
